comments:
Cannot repeat (sorry), but it happened twice, so I decided to log the stack 
trace in case it reveals anything.

This is what I did the first time:
- Open several editors (I had 6 open).
- Pin several - including the open editor.
- Grab the title tab of the open editor, and start dragging it.
- Press "ESC".
- Click on the text in the open editor.
First Walkback:

This is what I did the second time:
- closed the offending editor, and reopened the file, pinned again
- kept working in the same workspace as above for a while, with no problem
- left the workspace open overnight
- next day, first thing I did was click on that editor, and got the same 
walkback:

Log: Sun Oct 28 11:07:53 EST 2001
1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Log: Sun Oct 28 11:07:53 EST 2001
4 org.eclipse.ui 0 Index out of bounds

Not a duplicate of 5304.  That is an ArrayIndexOutOfBounds on bidi platform 
error.

This error is occurring because the range that is passed in as a parameter for 
the setStyleRange method falls outside the bounds of the text (i.e., a style 
range is being set for text that is not there).  This is occurring in the JFace 
TextViewer code (bracket highlighter).  Reassigning to EG.

Brackethighlighter has been rewritten a while ago. Tested scenarios in I-
20020129.
